DOC.brief_summary: The investigators specific aim is to compare the relationship between systemic fatty acid availability and insulin sensitivity in a relatively homogenous population of obese adults. The investigators anticipate 1) greater systemic fatty acid availability will be associated with lower insulin sensitivity and 2) greater systemic fatty acid availability will be associated with greater accumulation of fatty acid intermediates and pro-inflammatory markers.
DOC.brief_title: Relationship Between Systemic Fatty Acid Availability and Insulin Sensitivity
DOC.criteria: Body mass index [BMI]: 3545 kg/m2; All women must be premenopausal; Nonexerciser (no regularly planned exercise/physical activity) Weight instability ≥ ±5 lbs. in past month; medications known to affect lipid and/or glucose metabolism; Pregnancy or actively breast feeding
